note.p: The mixer parameters are on the SBS workstation, at the bottom of the Formula screen.

info.p: The nominal value (amount) of water to add can be set in liters if using a water-counter, or in seconds if the dosing is measured in time.

ul.li: The “Fine-Stop” value specifies that the water valves will close this many liters before the nominal value is reached.
The operator can switch between two modes for adding water: dosing in Liters and dosing in Seconds.

There are two Tolerance values:
If the actual water value is higher than the “nominal value” plus the “Tolerance+” value, an alarm will be generated.
If the actual water value is lower than the “nominal value” minus the “Tolerance-” value, there is no alarm. Instead, water will continue to be added until the nominal value is higher than set point minus “Tolerance-”.

step.cmd: Three mixing times can be set.

ul.li: Time in seconds for dry mixing. The dry mixing time begins when all of the batch material is received in the mixer.
Time in seconds for wet mixing. The wet mixing time begins when water dosing is finished.
Time is seconds for the mixer discharge slide stays open for discharging.
